instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.C7050: What is C7050? Capacitor between current sense lines on ISL6259 chip for battery current sensing, you should measure around 2.202 ohms across this. Often when the resistance across this capacitor is higher it is because one of the current sense resistors going to the ISL6259 chip has failed. When current sensing resistors between the shunt resistor and the ISL6259 power IC have failed the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.5V_S3: What is 5V_S3? 5V_S3 is an abbreviation of “PP5V_S3” which is a 5 volt power rail present in an S3 state. S3 (Suspend to RAM) is a state where the system saves its context to RAM, a faster but more power-consuming method than S4. The system shuts down most components except for RAM, which remains powered to retain the system state. PM_SLP_S4_L is required for this rail to be present. .
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Water Damage, MG light ON, No fan
threads.message:
Hello,

Water damaged.
Corrosion around J7050. Replaced <CAPACITOR>C7060</CAPACITOR> <CAPACITOR>C7050</CAPACITOR> <CAPACITOR>C7135</CAPACITOR>.
Explosion <CAPACITOR>C7435</CAPACITOR> (DDREG).  Pad under pin 1 destroyed (see attached picture). Jumper to <CAPACITOR>C7382</CAPACITOR>.
<CAPACITOR>C7435</CAPACITOR> is connected to <CHIP>U7400</CHIP>. <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> all pin 0V

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> - 12.6V
3V42 - 3.42V
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> - 3.11V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> - 5V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> - 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> - 0V jumps to 2.45V when connected to power
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> - 0V when power ON jumps to 3.38V for a fraction of a second

Please advice how to proceed.

Thanks!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Water Damage, MG light ON, No fan
threads.message:
If you note pulses at <SIGNAL>5V_S3</SIGNAL>/0, check if all big coils pulse at same time; L7430 in particular.

<CAPACITOR>C7435</CAPACITOR> is not connected with <CHIP>U7400</CHIP>, but <TRANSISTOR>Q7430</TRANSISTOR>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Water Damage, MG light ON, No fan
threads.message: No pulse on any of the big coils. Only L7130 shows 12.6V on pin 2 and 11.5V on pin 1.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Water Damage, MG light ON, No fan
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> - 0V jumps to 2.45V when connected to power
-----------------
No pulse on any of the big coils"
That is really impossible, believe me; <SIGNAL>5V_S3</SIGNAL> is located at L7520...

Please provide accurate information, or we cannot help.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Water Damage, MG light ON, No fan
threads.message:
I'm sorry I gave false information in my previous post (used a wrong charger).
L7520 - pulse around 3V
L7430 - pulse around 0.5V
L3095 - no pulse
L7320 - no pulse
L7310 - no pulse

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Water Damage, MG light ON, No fan
threads.message:
What about L7630?
If also pulses, then check for pulse at <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> too.
Trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> several times; you can catch higher pulse...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Water Damage, MG light ON, No fan
threads.message:
L7630 - pulse random from around 0.5 to 2.5V
<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> - pulse random around 0.4V to 1.97V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Water Damage, MG light ON, No fan
threads.message:
Should be better to use an o-scope; L7630 peak pulse must be 1.05V at pin 2.
Also check for pulse at <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> pin 7.

Did you try SMC bypass mode?

Don't worry about fan.
It will not spin until CPU gets really hot.

Check for corrosion on other areas.
Should be good to reball SMC also.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Water Damage, MG light ON, No fan
threads.message:
L7630 is max 0.63V on pin 2. Dont own an o-scope unfortunately.
<CHIP>U1950</CHIP> pulse around 0.7V
SMC bypass does nothing.
Check for corrosion in other areas again but nothing new detected.
Reball SMC is my last option? Need to order stencil in that case. Use solder paste or balls?
THanks!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Water Damage, MG light ON, No fan
threads.message: Use solder paste; many videos available on Internet.
